content.text: Find the equation of the curve which passes through the point (2, 17) and for which \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = 4x^3 + 1\).
Show that \(\sqrt{24} \times \sqrt{27} + \frac{9\sqrt{30}}{\sqrt{15}}\) can be written in the form \(a\sqrt{2}\), where \(a\) is an integer
Solve the equation \(\sqrt{3} (1 + x) = 2(x - 3)\), giving your answer in the form \(b + c\sqrt{3}\), where \(b\) and \(c\) are integers
Do not use a calculator in this question
Find an expression for \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x}\)
Hence, find the approximate change in \(y\) when \(x\) increases from 3 to \(3 + h\), where \(h\) is small.
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) are such that \(y = \ln (x^{2} + 1)\)
the period of \(y\),
the amplitude of \(y\)
Given that \(y = 7 \cos 10x - 3\), where the angle \(x\) is measured in degrees, state
Find the equation of the curve shown, in the form \(y = a \mathrm{g}(bx) + c\), where \(\mathrm{g}(x)\) is a trigonometric function and \(a\), \(b\) and \(c\) are integers to be found
Given that \(a\) is a constant, expand \((2 + a x)^{4}\), in ascending powers of \(x\), simplifying each term of your expansion
Given also that the coefficient of \(x^{2}\) is equal to the coefficient of \(x^{3}\),
show that \(a = 3\),
use your expansion to show that the value of \(1.97^{4}\) is 15.1 to 1 decimal place
Given that \(\mathbf{L} = (1 \quad 1 \quad 1 \quad 1)\), construct a matrix, \(\mathbf{M}\), of the number of tickets sold, such that the matrix product \(\mathbf{LM}\) can be found
Find the matrix product \(\mathbf{LM}\)
State what information is represented by the matrix product \(\mathbf{LM}\)
An adult ticket costs \(\)5,\(a student ticket costs\)\\(4\) and a child ticket costs \(\)3
Construct a matrix, \(\mathbf{N}\), of the ticket costs, such that the matrix product \(\mathbf{LMN}\) can be found and state what information is represented by the matrix product \(\mathbf{LMN}\)
Four cinemas, \(P\), \(Q\), \(R\) and \(S\) each sell adult, student and child tickets. The number of tickets sold by each cinema on one weekday were
\(Q\): 45 student
\(R\): 25 adult, 15 child
\(S\): 10 adult, 100 child
On each of the Venn diagrams below shade the region which represents the given set
Write the following using set notation
No student studies both music and design
There are 100 students in the group. 39 students study art, 45 study music and 36 study design. 12 students study both art and music. 25 students study both art and design
Complete the Venn diagram below to represent this information and hence find the number of students in the group who do not study any of these subjects
In a group of students, each student studies at most two of art, music and design. No student studies both music and design
\(A\) denotes the set of students who study art,
\(M\) denotes the set of students who study music,
\(D\) denotes the set of students who study design
A football club has 30 players. In how many different ways can a captain and a vice-captain be selected at random from these players?
the team must have exactly 1 mathematics teacher,
the team must have exactly 1 mathematics teacher and at least 4 computing teachers
A team of 11 teachers is to be chosen from 2 mathematics teachers, 5 computing teachers and 9 science teachers. Find the number of different teams that can be chosen if
Find the coordinates of \(A\) and of \(B\)
Find the equation of the perpendicular bisector of the line \(AB\), giving your answer in the form \(ax + by = c\), where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers
The curve \(3x^{2} + xy - y^{2} + 4y - 3 = 0\) and the line \(y = 2(1 - x)\) intersect at the points \(A\) and \(B\)
Draw the graph of \(\ln P\) against \(t\) on the grid below
Use the graph to estimate the value of \(P\) when \(t = 2.2\)
Find the gradient of the graph and state the coordinates of the point where the graph meets the vertical axis
Using your answers to part **(iii)**, show that \(P = ab^{t}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants to be found
Given that your equation in part **(iv)** is valid for values of \(t\) up to 10, find the smallest value of \(t\), correct to 1 decimal place, for which \(P\) is at least 1000
The table shows values of the variables \(t\) and \(P\)
Prove that \(\sin x(\cot x + \tan x) = \sec x.\)
Hence solve the equation \(|\sin x(\cot x + \tan x)| = 2\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 360^{\circ}\)
Find the distance between the particle's first two positions of instantaneous rest
Find the acceleration when \(t = \pi\)
A particle moves in a straight line so that, \(t\) seconds after passing a fixed point \(O\), its displacement, \(s \text{m}\), from \(O\) is given by
